page.title: 14Corbiere Lighthouse
page.content: {Corbiere lighthouse}is situated on outlying rocks on the southwest coast and is reached by a causeway at low tide. It is now{operated automatically from the shore. It's{visual range}is{ {17 miles.} It has a unique{radio beacon on 305.7 {Kilocycles}which in addition to it's normal function indicates the wind speed and direction in morse code every 6 minutes. A further facility is available in {fog}when a series of pips are broadcast, which if used with the fog horn, give yachtsmen their distance from the lighthouse. Each pip heard before the horn represents 1100 feet. These signals alternate with those for wind speed and direction. The{radio {signal range is at least 20 miles}but under certain conditions it can be received on the English coast.
